availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Berry (Harrison Co., Kentucky, trader and pvt in 9th Ky MTd (csa) and 2nd Ky Cav (csa))

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, trader and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of George W. Berry and Eveline Goddard Berry. Trader in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1860. Trader in 1862. Served in the 9th Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as private from September 21, 1862, to November 23, 1862. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as private and commissary sergeant from November 23, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 718.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0128.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, City of Lexington Deaths, File #110.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 586.
